application.desc: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

div.head: Date of submission:
div.p: We want to better understand the molecular basis of the sugar recognition by lectins and glycosyl hydrolases in order to develop sugar based inhibitors or for biotechnological apllications. For that we determine the Xray structures of protein in complex with several ligand at high resolution ( >2.2 Å).

div.head: Results and the conclusions of the study (main part):
div.p: The lectin BambL from opportunistic bacteria Burkholderia ambifaria is a fucose lectin homologue to RSL from Ralstonia solanacearum. This trimeric lectin forms a 6bled beta-propeller with two binding site per momoner (cf figure). It binds fucosylated blood group antigens and xyloglycans. Two datasets were collected on BambL crystals soaked with xyloglucan. The structure obtained revealed that the xyloglucan did not bind and could not displace the original ligand used for the cristallisation. Cocrystallisation with xyloglucan should be favoured now. Atomic resolution data were obtained for the best ligand of Bambl: Fucosyl-lactose and is under refinement.

Data were collected at 2.1Å on a crystal of PAIL cocristallised with a new inhibitor but unfortunetly the ligand was not found in the binding sites. Several complex structures of the arabinofuranosidase Arb93A from Fusarium oxyporum were solved at 1.9 Å. They did not bring new informations on the mechanim of this enzyme.

div.head: Justification and comments about the use of beam time (5 lines max.):
div.p: The beamline is very stable and has a sample changer. It is appropriate for data collection on protein crystals at high resolution. We tested around 45 crystals and collected eight datasets.
